comments:
Hi,

I'm having this problem: When you try to "Generate Entities" the following wizard does give you your Connection Profiles, so far so good. But now, if you connect to the database an error is thrown and you don't get any Schema information.
I might say that it could easily be DTP what causes the problem because I'm also having an issue there (Bug 180356) that seems quite coming from the same direction.

The following exception is thrown when you try to connect to the database from within the Generate Entities wizard..

Could you specify the database and the version?
Thanks.

I was trying to connect to PostgreSQL 8.2.3, JDBC3 driver either 8.2 or 8.3.
I also tried using MySQL (JDBC 5.0 and 5.1), but as I mentioned in my posting before, I'm having an issue with MySQL anyway (Bug 180356)

thx

Created an attachment (id=71034)
Fix for PostgreSQL

Simple fix to handle PostgreSQL databases.

This bug prevents users of the PostgreSQL DB from using Dali Entity Generation functionality.  We discovered here that PostgreSQL had yet another variation on how it deals with default catalog name versus other DB's.  We have accounted for this in this simple, ultra-low risk patch.  The way the patch is done prevents changing existing, working behavior by adding an if else-if to the end of a else-if chain.  This code is only hit if all other options for setting the catalog name have failed.

I have reviewed and tested the patch, and request PMC approval.
Sounds like a "limited use case" that I tend not to approve, but ... as long as it makes RC3, looks like a good catch.
